Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos stand; interior glazed at top, reserved below; exterior: torus rime glazed; below, black-figure decoration consisting of upper part of two birds with added red on wing, to right.
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Sophilos
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.570.e, 1888,0601.570.h, 1965,0930.807 and 1965,0930.808.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 480, no. B837)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 13, p. 15)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 225, no. 8a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0271) (Phase 1)
